section1.description: Cookies are small text files that are stored on your device (computer, tablet, smartphone) when you visit a website. Cookies allow the website to remember your actions and preferences over a period of time.
section1.item1: Keep your session active while browsing
section1.item4: Analyze how the website is used

technical.title: Technical (Essential) Cookies
technical.purpose: Purpose: Necessary for basic website functionality.
technical.consent: Consent: Do not require consent (Art. 22.2 LSSI-CE).

analytics.title: Analytics Cookies
analytics.purpose: Purpose: Analyze user behavior and improve the service.
analytics.examples: Examples: Visit statistics, popular pages, browsing time.

marketing.title: Marketing/Advertising Cookies
marketing.purpose: Purpose: Offer personalized advertising and measure campaigns.
marketing.examples: Examples: Retargeting, personalized advertising, conversion tracking.

section3.title: 3. Technical (Essential) Cookies

summary.item1: This DPA complements our Terms and Conditions for business customers

section1.title: 1. Definitions
section1.description: For the purposes of this Data Processing Agreement (hereinafter, "the Agreement"), the following shall be understood as:

controller.definition: The natural or legal person who contracts Itineramio services and who determines the purposes and means of personal data processing.

processor.definition: who processes personal data on behalf of the Controller in the context of providing the service.

personalData.definition: Any information about an identified or identifiable natural person that the Controller enters into the Itineramio platform.

processing.definition: Any operation performed on personal data: collection, recording, organization, structuring, storage, adaptation, modification, extraction, consultation, use, communication, dissemination or any other form of enabling access, comparison, interconnection, limitation, deletion or destruction.

gdpr.definition: Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data.

dataSubject.definition: Natural person whose personal data is being processed (e.g., guests, end users).

section2.title: 2. Object of the Agreement
section2.description: This Agreement establishes the conditions under which {{companyName}} (Data Processor) will process personal data on behalf of the Client (Data Controller) in the context of providing digital manual services for tourist accommodations.

relationship.title: Relationship with Other Documents:
relationship.description: This DPA complements and forms an integral part of:
relationship.item1: The Terms and Conditions of service use
relationship.item3: Any current subscription contract between the parties

section2.conflict: In case of conflict between this DPA and other documents, the provisions of this DPA shall prevail regarding the processing of personal data.

purpose.title: 3.1 Purpose of Processing
purpose.description: The Processor will process personal data exclusively for the following purposes:
purpose.item1: Store and process Client property information
purpose.item2: Process content of digital manuals created by the Client
purpose.item3: Generate QR codes and access URLs for guests
purpose.item7: Provide technical support to the Client

nature.title: 3.2 Nature of Processing
nature.description: Collection, recording, organization, structuring, storage, adaptation, modification, extraction, consultation, use, communication by transmission, dissemination (to guests with authorized access), limitation, deletion and destruction of data.

instructions.title: Processing According to Instructions
instructions.description: Process personal data only following documented instructions from the Controller, including regarding transfers of data to third countries or international organizations, unless required to do so by Union or Member State law.

confidentiality.title: Confidentiality
confidentiality.description: Ensure that persons authorized to process personal data have committed to confidentiality or are under an appropriate statutory obligation of confidentiality.

security.title: Security Measures
security.description: Implement all appropriate technical and organizational measures to ensure a level of security appropriate to the risk, including encryption, pseudonymization where appropriate, confidentiality, integrity, availability and permanent resilience of processing systems.

assistance.title: Assistance to the Controller
assistance.description: Assist the Controller as far as possible so that it can comply with its obligations to respond to requests for the exercise of data subject rights: access, rectification, erasure, objection, restriction, portability.

dpia.title: Impact Assessments
dpia.description: Help the Controller ensure compliance with obligations relating to data protection impact assessments and prior consultations with the supervisory authority, taking into account the nature of processing and information available.

deletion.title: Data Deletion
deletion.description: Delete or return all personal data to the Controller after the end of the provision of processing services, and delete existing copies, unless retention of the data is required under Union or Member State law.

audit.title: Audit Information
audit.description: Make available to the Controller all information necessary to demonstrate compliance with the obligations of Article 28 of the GDPR, as well as allow for and contribute to audits, including inspections, by the Controller or another auditor authorized by the Controller.

section5.title: 5. Sub-processors
section5.description: The Processor may engage other Processors (Sub-processors) to perform specific processing activities. The Controller authorizes the Processor to engage the following Sub-processors:

guarantees.title: Sub-processor Guarantees:

guarantees.item2: The same data protection obligations as those established in this DPA apply
guarantees.item3: The Processor remains fully responsible to the Controller for Sub-processor compliance

changes.title: Changes to Sub-processors:
changes.description: The Processor will inform the Controller of any planned change regarding the addition or replacement of Sub-processors with at least 30 days notice, giving the Controller the opportunity to object to such changes for legitimate data protection reasons.

section6.title: 6. Security Measures
section6.description: The Processor implements the following technical and organizational measures to ensure the security of personal data:

encryption.title: Encryption and Pseudonymization
encryption.item2: AES-256 encryption of data at rest

section8.description: The Processor will assist the Controller in the exercise of data subject rights:

procedure.title: Assistance Procedure:

section9.title: 9. Security Breach Notification
section9.description: In case of a personal data security breach, the Processor will follow this protocol:

notification.title: Immediate Notification
notification.description: The Processor will notify the Controller without undue delay and, at the latest, within 24 hours of becoming aware of the security breach.

content.title: Notification Information:
content.description: The notification will include, at a minimum:
content.item1: Description of the nature of the security breach
content.item2: Categories and approximate number of affected data subjects
content.item3: Categories and approximate number of affected data records
content.item5: Measures taken or proposed to remedy the breach
content.item6: Measures proposed to mitigate possible negative effects

cooperation.title: Cooperation:
cooperation.description: The Processor will fully cooperate with the Controller and provide all necessary assistance so that it can comply with its obligation to notify the breach to the supervisory authority (AEPD) within 72 hours, and to data subjects when appropriate.

section10.title: 10. Audits and Inspections
section10.description: The Controller has the right to audit the Processor's compliance with this DPA.

documentary.title: Documentary Audits:
documentary.description: The Processor will provide the Controller, upon request and annually:
documentary.item1: SOC 2 Type II certifications from infrastructure providers
documentary.item3: Evidence of compliance with security measures
documentary.item4: Documentation of staff data protection training

onSite.title: On-Site Audits:
onSite.description: The Controller may request an on-site audit with the following conditions:
onSite.item1: Prior notice of at least 30 days
onSite.item2: Maximum frequency of one audit per year (unless there is a security breach)
onSite.item3: Normal business hours and without interfering with Processor operations
onSite.item4: May be performed by the Controller or qualified external auditor
onSite.item5: Audit costs borne by the Controller

facilities.title: Access to Facilities:
facilities.description: Since the Processor uses cloud services, physical access to servers is not applicable. Audits will focus on logical controls, policies and procedures.

duration.title: 11.1 Duration
duration.description: This DPA will come into force on the date of acceptance of the Terms and Conditions by the Client and will remain in force as long as the Processor provides services involving the processing of personal data.

termination.description: Once the provision of processing services has ended, the Processor will:

return.title: Option 1: Data Return
return.description: At the Controller's request, the Processor will return all personal data in structured format (JSON/CSV) within 30 days of contract termination.

deletion.description: If the Controller does not request return:

upgrade.title: Upgrade (Improve Plan)
upgrade.description: When upgrading to a higher plan:
upgrade.item2: Credit is calculated for unused time on your current plan
upgrade.item3: That credit is applied to the cost of the new plan
upgrade.item4: You only pay the prorated difference until the end of your billing period
upgrade.example: Example: If you are on BASIC (EUR9/month) and switch to HOST (EUR29/month) mid-month, you will be charged approximately EUR10 (difference of EUR20 prorated to 15 days).

downgrade.title: Downgrade (Reduce Plan)
downgrade.description: When changing to a lower plan:
downgrade.item1: The change is effective at the end of your current period
downgrade.item2: You maintain access to higher plan features until the end of the period
downgrade.item3: From the next period, the new cheaper plan is billed
downgrade.item4: There are no additional charges or penalties
downgrade.note: Note: If you have more properties than the lower plan limit, you will need to reduce the number of active properties before the change takes effect.

section7.title: 7. Cancellation
section7.description: You can cancel your subscription at any time without penalties or additional charges.

process.title: Cancellation process:
process.step4: 4. You will receive a confirmation email

effects.title: Effects of cancellation:
effects.item1: Your subscription remains active until the end of the current billing period
effects.item2: No more charges are made after cancellation
effects.item3: You retain access to all features until the end of the paid period
effects.item4: Your data and properties are maintained for 90 days after cancellation
effects.item5: You can reactivate your subscription at any time within those 90 days

section7.afterPeriod: After 90 days from cancellation without reactivation, your properties will become inactive. Data will be retained according to our

section8.title: 8. Refund Policy
section8.description: Subscription payments are non-refundable except in the following circumstances:

duplicateCharges.title: Duplicate Charges
duplicateCharges.description: If you are charged twice by mistake, we immediately refund the duplicate charge.

technicalError.title: Technical Billing Error
technicalError.description: If a technical error causes an incorrect charge, the erroneous amount is refunded within 5-7 business days.

serviceUnavailable.title: Service Unavailable
serviceUnavailable.description: If the service is inaccessible for more than 72 hours due to technical problems on our part, you may request a prorated refund for the downtime.

noRefund.title: No refund in these cases:
noRefund.item1: Voluntary cancellation before the end of the period
noRefund.item2: Change of mind or dissatisfaction with the service
noRefund.item3: Non-use of the service during the billing period
noRefund.item4: Suspension for violation of terms of use

section8.request: To request a justified refund, contact {{email}} indicating your transaction ID and reason. We process requests within a maximum of 10 business days.

section9.title: 9. Taxes and Invoicing
section9.description: We comply with all applicable tax and invoicing obligations in Spain and the European Union.

vat.title: VAT (Value Added Tax):
vat.spain: Customers in Spain: Current VAT applies (currently 21%)
vat.euB2B: B2B customers in the EU: VAT applies according to reverse charge mechanism (provide valid VAT-ID)
vat.euB2C: B2C customers in the EU: Destination country VAT according to EU regulations
vat.nonEU: Customers outside the EU: No VAT (0%)

invoices.title: Electronic Invoices:
invoices.description: We issue electronic invoices compliant with Spanish regulations (Law 25/2013). All invoices include:
invoices.item5: Tax base, applied VAT and total

section9.download: You can download all your invoices at any time from Account - Billing - History. Invoices are kept for 10 years according to legal requirements.

section10.title: 10. Payment Failures
section10.description: If a payment fails due to insufficient funds, expired card or other reason, we follow this process:

step1.title: Immediate Notification
step1.description: We send you an email informing you of the payment failure and asking you to update your payment method.

step2.title: Grace Period (3 days)
step2.description: Your service remains active for 3 days to give you time to resolve the problem.

step3.title: Automatic Retry
step3.description: We try to charge again after 3 days. If it fails again, we send another reminder.

step4.title: Second Retry (7 days)
step4.description: Last charge attempt at 7 days. If it fails, your account goes to "Suspended" status.

step5.title: Suspension (after 7 days)
step5.description: If we do not receive payment, your account is temporarily suspended. You can reactivate it by updating your payment method and settling the outstanding debt.

section10.important: Important: During suspension, your properties will not be accessible to guests. Reactivating your subscription restores access immediately.

section11.title: 11. Price Changes
section11.description: We reserve the right to modify our prices, but always with transparency and respect for our customers:

guarantees.title: Price change guarantees:
guarantees.item1: 30 days advance notice: We will notify you by email at least one month in advance
guarantees.item2: Grandfathering: Existing customers keep their price for at least 6 months
guarantees.item3: Right to cancel: You can cancel without penalty if you disagree
guarantees.item4: Clarity: We will clearly explain the reasons for the price change

section11.acceptance: Your continued acceptance of the service after notification will constitute your acceptance of the new price.
